body:
I recently got an account on Piz Daint and noticed there's one unit test failing. The failure seems to depend on the order in which tests are run.


### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
culpo@daint106:~/github/spack> spack test
...
======================================== 1 failed, 1258 passed, 102 skipped, 1 xfailed in 293.22 seconds =========================================
```

### Error Message

```console
==================================================================== FAILURES ====================================================================
__________________________________________________ test_get_module_cmd_from_bash_using_modules ___________________________________________________

    @pytest.mark.skipif(MODULE_NOT_DEFINED, reason='Depends on defined module fn')
    def test_get_module_cmd_from_bash_using_modules():
        module_list_proc = subprocess.Popen(['module list'],
                                            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                                            stderr=subprocess.STDOUT,
                                            executable='/bin/bash',
                                            shell=True)
        module_list_proc.wait()
        module_list = module_list_proc.stdout.read()
    
        module_cmd = get_module_cmd_from_bash()
        module_cmd_list = module_cmd('list', output=str, error=str)
    
        # Lmod command reprints some env variables on every invocation.
        # Test containment to avoid false failures on lmod systems.
>       assert module_list in module_cmd_list
E       AssertionError: assert 'Currently Loaded Modulefiles:\n  1) modules/3.2.10.6\n  2) cce/8.7.3\n  3) craype-network-aries\n  4) craype/2.5.15\n...) zlib/.1.2.8\n 26) libxml2/.2.9.3\n 27) ncurses/.6.0\n 28) gettext/.0.19.7\n 29) Perl/5.22.1-bare\n 30) git/.2.13.1\n' in 'fill python list\n'

module_parsing.py:123: AssertionError
======================================== 1 failed, 1258 passed, 102 skipped, 1 xfailed in 293.22 seconds =========================================
```


Notice that if we run:
```console
culpo@daint106:~/github/spack> spack test --lf
============================================================== test session starts ===============================================================
platform linux2 -- Python 2.7.13, pytest-3.2.5, py-1.4.34, pluggy-0.4.0
rootdir: /users/culpo/github/spack/lib/spack/spack/test, inifile: pytest.ini
collected 1362 items                                                                                                                              
run-last-failure: rerun previous 1 failure

module_parsing.py .

=========================================================== slowest 20 test durations ============================================================
0.06s call     module_parsing.py::test_get_module_cmd_from_bash_using_modules
0.00s setup    module_parsing.py::test_get_module_cmd_from_bash_using_modules
0.00s teardown module_parsing.py::test_get_module_cmd_from_bash_using_modules
============================================================= 1361 tests deselected ==============================================================
=================================================== 1 passed, 1361 deselected in 3.24 seconds ====================================================
```
the failing test now passes (this might then be related to some state set by previous tests that is not appropriately cleaned up?).


### Information on your system

The error happens on [Piz Daint](https://www.cscs.ch/computers/piz-daint/)
title: Unit tests failing on Piz Daint
